alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Colorado; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 08 at 3:25PM CDT until August 09 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE BRAZOS VALLEY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE BRAZOS VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Burleson, Brazos, Washington, Colorado and Austin. * TIMING...For the first Red Flag Warning, until 10 PM CDT this evening. For the second Red Flag Warning, from 1 PM to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 28 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 105. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create explosive fire growth potential.
